data.chText: 偏见；成见
data.enText: an unreasonable dislike of or preference for a person, group, custom, etc., especially when it is based on their race, religion, sex, etc.

data.chText: 种族偏见的受害者
data.enText: a victim of racial prejudice

data.chText: 他们的决定是由于无知和偏见。
data.enText: Their decision was based on ignorance and prejudice.

data.chText: 对来自其他欧盟国家的劳工可说并无偏见。
data.enText: There is little prejudice against workers from other EU states.

data.chText: 我得承认我对英国大学有所偏爱。
data.enText: I must admit to a prejudice in favour of British universities.
without prejudice (to sth)

data.chText: 不损害其他权益；无损于合法权利
data.enText: without affecting any other legal matter

data.chText: 他们同意赔偿，但不承认有罪。
data.enText: They agreed to pay compensation without prejudice (= without admitting guilt ) .

data.chText: 使怀有（或形成）偏见
data.enText: to influence sb so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about sb/sth

data.chText: 控方律师一直力图使陪审团对她形成偏见。
data.enText: The prosecution lawyers have been trying to prejudice the jury against her.

data.chText: 损害；有损于
data.enText: to have a harmful effect on sth

data.chText: 任何延误都会损及这个孩子的身心健康。
data.enText: Any delay will prejudice the child's welfare.

data.chText: 以上各词均含伤害、损害之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to have a bad effect on sb/sth.
damage

data.chText: 指毁坏、破坏、伤害、损害：
data.enText: to cause physical harm to sth, making it less attractive, useful or valuable; to have a bad effect on sb/sth's life, health, happiness or chances of success

data.chText: 火灾使市政厅遭到严重破坏。
data.enText: The fire badly damaged the town hall.

data.chText: 感情上受伤害的孩子
data.enText: emotionally damaged children
hurt

data.chText: 指伤害、损害：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to have a bad effect on sb/sth's life, health, happiness or chances of success

data.chText: 努力工作绝无害处。
data.enText: Hard work never hurt anyone.
harm

data.chText: 指伤害、损害：
data.enText: to have a bad effect on sb/sth's life, health, happiness or chances of success

data.chText: 污染会危及海洋生物。
data.enText: Pollution can harm marine life.

data.chText: 用damage、hurt还是harm？
以上各词均可指对人的伤害。某种行为或决定有损人或国家的机会、前景、利益、声誉或形象可用damage/hurt/harm。hurt较非正式，用于否定句时尤其如此：
data.enText: All these words can be used to talk about how things can put people in a weaker position. An action or decision can damage/hurt/harm a person's or country's chances , prospects , interests , reputation or image . Hurt is slightly less formal, especially when it is used in negative statements.

data.chText: 等上一会儿对他无妨。
data.enText: It won't hurt him to have to wait a bit.
It won't damage/harm him to have to wait a bit.

data.chText: harm亦常用于自然界中的事物（如野生生物和环境）受到人类活动的影响。
data.enText: Harm is also often used to talk about ways in which things in the natural world such as wildlife and the environment are affected by human activity.
damage, hurt or harm?
impair

data.chText: 指损害、削弱（健康、能力或机会）：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to damage sb's health, abilities or chances

data.chText: 即使一杯酒也可能影响驾驶操作。
data.enText: Even one drink can impair driving performance.
prejudice

data.chText: 指损害、有损于（健康、幸福或机会）：
data.enText: ( formal ) to damage sb's health, happiness or chances

data.chText: 她隐瞒了可能不利于她的当事人的证据。
data.enText: She did not disclose evidence that was likely to prejudice her client's case.
to damage/hurt/harm/impair/prejudice sb's health/chances
to damage/hurt/harm/prejudice sb's interests
to damage/hurt/harm sb's reputation
to seriously/severely/greatly/irreparably damage/hurt/harm/impair/prejudice sb/sth
to badly damage/hurt/harm/impair sb/sth

simple_means.memory_skill: pre 预先 + judic 判断；法律 + e → 预先的判断 → 偏见

ex.enText: He has a strong painting bias.
She has a bias against jazz music.

ex.chText: 你对双方应该不偏不倚。
ex.enText: You should have no bias in favour of either side.

synonyms.bx: 指对某类事物拥有天赋或兴趣；也指因个人的好恶或偏见而对某人或某物作出的不正确的、有倾向性的判断。

ex.enText: Swallows have an aptitude for building nests.
He has an aptitude for painting.

synonyms.bx: 指做某类事情的习性，侧重指非后天形成的自然本能；也指在学习方面的资质或技能，常后接介词 for。

ex.enText: He has a bent for music.
The natural bent of  my mind was to science.

synonyms.bx: 强调对某个领域有特殊的爱好，或在某方面有特长。

ex.chText: 父母通常偏爱最小的孩子。
ex.enText: Usually, parents show favour to the youngest of their children.

ex.chText: 他小心谨慎地不偏袒任何人。
ex.enText: He is careful to show favour to no one.

synonyms.bx: 指对某人或某个群体的偏袒、特别照顾。

ex.enText: She has an inclination for sports.
He has no inclination to be a teacher.

synonyms.bx: 指某人想做某事的一种意愿。

ex.enText: I have a preference for country life.
Ben has a preference of physics to/over English.

synonyms.bx: 指基于个人价值观、偏见或个人喜好程度上的选择。

ex.chText: 在美国，黑人依然要面对种族歧视问题。
ex.enText: African Americans still face racial prejudice in America.

ex.chText: 他对流行音乐怀有偏见。
ex.enText: He has a prejudice against pop music.

synonyms.bx: 尤指因种族、性别、宗教等方面的差异而形成的对特定事物不合理的否定态度。

data.enText: without prejudice (to sth)

data.chText: 不损害其他权益；无损于合法权利
data.enText: without affecting any other legal matter

data.chText: 他们同意赔偿，但不承认有罪。
data.enText: They agreed to pay compensation without prejudice (= without admitting guilt ) .

tr: a partiality that prevents objective consideration of an issue or situation

value.def: Prejudice is an unreasonable dislike of a particular group of people or things, or a preference for one group of people or things over another.

example.ex: There was a deep-rooted racial prejudice long before the two countries became rivals and went to war...
example.tran: 早在这两个国家成为敌人并且兵戎相见之前，它们之间就有了根深蒂固的种族偏见。

example.ex: There is widespread prejudice against workers over 45...
example.tran: 人们普遍对年龄超过45岁的工人存有偏见。

example.ex: He said he hoped the Swiss authorities would investigate the  case thoroughly and without prejudice.
example.tran: 他说希望瑞士当局会彻底地、不带任何偏见地调查这个案件。

value.def: If you prejudice someone or something, you influence them so that they are unfair in some way.

example.ex: I think your South American youth has prejudiced you...
example.tran: 我认为你在南美度过的青少年时代让你产生了偏见。

example.ex: The report was held back for fear of prejudicing his trial...
example.tran: 因为担心会使他的审判有失公正，这篇报道被暂时压了下来。

example.ex: He claimed his case would be prejudiced if it became known he was refusing to answer questions.
example.tran: 他声称如果大家都知道他拒绝回答问题，就会对他的案件抱有成见。

value.tran: 使有成见；使有偏见；使出现偏袒

value.def: If someone prejudices another person's situation, they do something which makes it worse than it should be.

example.ex: Her study was not in any way intended to prejudice the future development of the college...
example.tran: 她的研究绝对无意损害这所大学未来的发展。

example.ex: They claim the council has prejudiced their health by failing to deal with asbestos.
example.tran: 他们声称，理事会没有处理好石棉的问题，从而损害了他们的健康。

value.def: If you take an action without prejudice to an existing situation, your action does not change or harm that situation.

example.ex: We accept the outcome of the inquiry, without prejudice to the unsettled question of territorial waters.
example.tran: 我们接受了调查结果，并没有使悬而未决的领海问题进一步恶化。

value.tran: 无损于；没有对…造成不利；没有对…带来改变

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to judge, law 判断；法律
rootsaffixes.title: judg, judic(i)

partsOfSpeech.dec: ad 加强 + judg 判断；法律 + e → 一再判断 → 裁决
ad 加强 + judic 判断；法律 + ate 做，造成，使… → 不断加强判断正确性 → 裁判
in 不 + judicious 明智的；有判断力的 → 不明智的
judg 判断；法律 + ment 表结果 → 判断，判断力
judic 判断；法律 + ial …的 → 法律的 → 司法的
judici 判断；法律 + ary 场所 → 司法部
judici 判断；法律 + ous …的 → 有判断力的
pre 预先 + judg 判断；法律 + e → 预先断定
pre 预先 + judic 判断；法律 + e → 预先的判断 → 偏见
